header_summary:
Yuval Kogman raises concerns about Liquisabi's ability to accurately calculate coordinator earnings, criticizing the marketing of their services as 'free' and discussing the inaccuracies surrounding wabisabi on bitcointalk threads. Kogman, with his significant background in coinjoin implementations, highlights the importance of transparency and honesty in cryptocurrency development ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALiT-Zoj5fd2zK3moMLo+S-L8xTyB2qgCNU_ocm_6mce832JcQ@mail.gmail.com/T/#mb93df43d7dfdbc6ee7f2114941910e474928e19d)).

Agustin Cruz proposes a preemptive strategy against quantum computing threats to Bitcoin, suggesting a migration plan to safeguard the coin supply, including lost wallets, to prevent potential hacking and ensure the ecosystem's security. This approach emphasizes the necessity of decisive action before quantum advancements pose a direct threat ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAJDmzYzUAzoCj3da-3M_ast0_+Qxf3_J1OXWf88B2D-R70pPrg@mail.gmail.com/T/#m87ff7212c78ab0144ba98eb1f58b1ba13a602021)).

Antoine Riard discusses the trade-offs between individual and bundled Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs) to address protocol vulnerabilities, advocating for separate BIPs to avoid complexity and undocumented future rules. The dialogue among developers is crucial for ethical and technical protocol evolution, balancing transparency and security in the implementation of fixes ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/87360fbe-30dd-4e18-acbf-7416c47ebc61n@googlegroups.com/T/#m813d9c471068ade2c71b68020017f600e569a0a6)).

Jsarenik introduces a novel method for block hash shortening, aimed at efficient management of time-sensitive entries, showcasing the 'shortened kode' and 'anecdotal kode'. This development, demonstrated through various resources, invites feedback from the community to refine the technique further, highlighting the developer's commitment to innovation and user engagement ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/anecdotal-kode-code-for-humans/1441)).

Josh unveils a tool that enhances the process of making inscriptions on the Bitcoin blockchain, focusing on efficiency by avoiding new UTXO generation. This innovation forwards payment amounts directly as miner fees, reducing transaction costs and preventing UTXO bloat, with detailed guidance provided for interested users ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/multisigbackup-com-backup-and-recover-a-k-of-n-descriptor-using-only-n-seeds/1430/6)).

recent_posts.title: Reiterating centralized coinjoin (Wasabi & Samourai) deanonymization attacks
recent_posts.summary:
- Yuval Kogman criticizes Liquisabi's inaccuracy in marketing 'free' coordinator earnings.
- Kogman highlights misleading information about wabisabi by Kruw on bitcointalk threads.
- His background in joinstr and wasabi underlines his credibility in cryptocurrency discussions.

recent_posts.title: Proposal for Quantum-Resistant Address Migration Protocol (QRAMP) BIP
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests a mandatory migration to shield Bitcoin from quantum computing threats.
- It aims to protect all wallets, including lost ones, to prevent unauthorized coin circulation.
- Implementing the plan now allows for a smooth transition, ensuring Bitcoin's ecosystem safety.

recent_posts.title: Update on the Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses software fork deployment in Bitcoin for security fixes.
- It debates between separate BIPs or a bundled approach to address vulnerabilities.
- Importance of review and transparency in the development process is emphasized.

recent_posts.title: Highly Available Lightning Channels Revisited – ROUTE OR OUT
recent_posts.summary:
- Pathfinding in networks is manageable, with a preference for heuristic approaches over probing.
- Probing's impact on network traffic and privacy is less concerning, especially with Lightning Service Providers.
- The shift towards fewer privacy-concerned nodes improves network payment success, amid evolving challenges.

recent_posts.title: Anecdotal kode (code) for humans
recent_posts.summary:
- New block hash shortening introduces "shortened kode" (sk) and "anecdotal kode" (ak).
- Anecdotal kode's foundation uses XOR on double octets, inspired by Bitcoin shortform.
- Feedback requested to refine the technique, noting `0xFFFFFF` may be too small for some uses.

recent_posts.title: MultisigBackup.com: Backup and recover a k-of-n descriptor using only n seeds
recent_posts.summary:
- A novel tool improves Bitcoin blockchain inscriptions, focusing on efficiency without new UTXOs.
- It integrates with mempool.space for real-time transaction tracking, using funds directly for miner fees.
- A comprehensive guide and code repository are available for detailed exploration of the tool's functionality.

active_posts.title: Reiterating centralized coinjoin (Wasabi & Samourai) deanonymization attacks
active_posts.summary:
- Wasabi & GingerWallet alongside CoinJoin protocols face significant deanonymization risks.
- Vulnerabilities are linked to protocol design flaws, particularly with coordinator trust issues.
- Economic incentives and poor coin management practices further elevate privacy and security concerns.

active_posts.title: Update on the Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- Matt Corallo proposed enhancing Bitcoin's security in 2019 through various measures.
- The revised proposal adds methods to counter timewarp and Murch-Zawy attacks, among others.
- A draft Bitcoin Improvement Proposal detailing these updates is currently in progress.

active_posts.title: Proposal for Quantum-Resistant Address Migration Protocol (QRAMP) BIP
active_posts.summary:
- Agustin Cruz proposes Quantum-Resistant Address Migration Protocol (QRAMP) to secure Bitcoin.
- QRAMP requires moving funds to quantum-resistant addresses to prevent quantum computing threats.
- The proposal includes a transition timeline, addresses challenges, and invites public feedback on GitHub.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis suggests improvements for Bitcoin's security and performance, including solving the timewarp vulnerability.
- It proposes constraints on non-SegWit transactions and invalidating small transactions to improve network efficiency.
- Community debate arises over proposals to reduce block size, reflecting concerns on network scalability and efficiency.

active_posts.title: How to linearize your cluster
active_posts.summary:
- Optimizing transaction clusters in cryptocurrency networks enhances transaction processing efficiency.
- Advanced linearization strategies include bottleneck splitting and employing iterative search for high-feerate subsets.
- The current implementation leverages LIFO stacks and selection strategies to optimize the algorithm's performance.

active_posts.title: ZK-gossip for lightning channel announcements
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal enhances taproot gossip protocol privacy using Utreexo and ZK-proofs.
- It introduces a `channel_announcement_2` message with a Musig2 signature for UTXO control.
- Feedback on the Rust implementation of this privacy-focused extension is encouraged.

today_in_history_posts.title: Possible change to the MIT license
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's MIT license usage has sparked suitability concerns due to hard forks.
- Suggested amendment: restrict license to projects fully compatible with Bitcoin Core.
- Enforcing this could deter the spread of misleading "Bitcoin Whatever" forks.

today_in_history_posts.title: Pizza for (lightning) bitcoins?
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A man used the lightning network for trading and arranged pizza delivery in London.
- He confirmed payment by providing a unique preimage to the delivery driver.
- Lightning nodes are uncommon, questioning the practicality of such transactions over on-chain.

today_in_history_posts.title: An Onchain Implementation Of Mining Feerate Futures
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Mining fee futures are introduced to stabilize unpredictable blockchain onchain fees.
- A binary contract allows users and miners to hedge against fee fluctuations with a Taproot address.
- This scheme aims to reduce risks from fee volatility for both users and miners, enhancing blockchain stability.
